Control Room.Body:
It's warm in the Control Room of the Hotel class Nuclear Submarine you find yourself in.
The gentle hum of electronics, and dim flashing lights are the only thing keeping you from dozing off.
The man next you turn the page of his book.
Suddenly, a blaring noise jolts you to attention:

Внимание, Уважаемые товарищи
в подводная лодка складывается неблагоприятная радиационная обстановка

Something is not right.
The lights have gone out.
The system has initiated SCRAM.
The reactor has begun to melt down.

Choices.Text: Run to the auxiliary control room

control Room2.Body:
The control room is filled with the sounds of alarms, and desperate yelling.
Your seat has been taken by another worker, preoccupied with shutting off the alarms and lights.
You need to keep going

Choices.Text: Run to the auxiliary control room

Radio Room.Body:
Frantic calls are being made.
Workers running in and out of the room,
Everyones trying to figure out what's going on.
“Comrade!” someone yells, you turn.
“You need to get to the reactor! Somethings wrong! And do NOT forget your tools!”

Aux Control Room.Body:
Men are scrambling, pressing buttons, reading notes, yelling fills the room.
The machines of the backup control room are beeping loudly, lights flashing, warning of the impending danger.
“Comrade!”You hear over the noise.
“What are you doing here?” they ask.
“You need to get to the Reactor NOW!”

Maintenance hall.Body:
The hall is strangely empty. Aside from the alarm blaring.
The lights are dim, making you stumble around the room.
Finally you make your way towards it, your toolbox.

pick up.Body: You hastily grab the toolbox, ready to complete your mission

Pump Room.Body:
The sound coming from the pumps is deafening.
Creaking and groaning as the pressure builds from the heat of the reactor.
Some have already burst, sending irradiated steam from their fissures.
That's not a good sign.

Medbay.Body:
Beds which are normally empty now have men, hands and faces from minor burns
If you had to guess, these men were near the reactor and the pumps when SCRAM was initiated and the pumps were damaged. Scalded by hot steam.
You need to continue.

Choices.Text: Go upstairs to the storage hold

Storage.Body:
The storage hall is relatively quite. Its not a very important place to be.
Stumbling around the large room your hand hits something.
It's a large box, a radio perhaps, maybe it's got a signal.

Reactor Hall.Body:
At this point the reactor is above 800 degrees celsius.
Decay heat from the control rods being inserted has caused the temp to spike
From this angle you can see that the cooling pumps have failed.
You need to fix them.

radio.Body:
Moving though the darkness, you stumble into a large desk, examining it,
your hands find the dials on the old Ham Radio.
You aren't quite sure who brought it on board, let alone if it even works.
But as your hands fiddle with the various dials and buttons,
the gentle hum of static fills the air around you.
Slowly, the sound of a symphony fades in
Lyrics accompanying it later… it’s hauntingly beautiful.

tools.Body:
You pull out the rusty old toolbox, hands running over the pieces of metal that could save you, or end you.An idea forms, water needs to be running to the reactor, cooling the core, preventing further damage.
A water pipe near it would supply the necessary coolant. Gathering yourselves.

After many hours, the two pipes have been welded. The core is being cooled, preventing further damage to the core and to the vessel as a whole.
